greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{j=0..n} Sum_{k=0..j} Stirling2(j - k, k).
comment: The row sums of A320955 seen as a triangle are the partial sums of the antidiagonal sums of the triangle of the Stirling set numbers.
mathematica: a[n_] := Sum[Sum[StirlingS2[j - k, k], {k, 0, j}], {j, 0, n}]; Array[a, 30, 0] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Nov 06 2018 *)
program: (PARI) a(n)={sum(j=0, n, sum(k=0, j, abs(stirling(j-k, k, 2))))} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Nov 06 2018
xref: Row sums of A320955 seen as a triangle.
results.author: _Peter Luschny_, Nov 06 2018
